009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
015
016/**
017 * This class represents a line in slope-intercept form: y = k x + d.
018 * Instances are immutable. Not all possible lines in the 2D plane
019 * can be represented.
020 * TODO: add implementation of Curve2d
021 */
022public class SlopeInterceptLine {
023        
024        private final double k, d;
025
026        public SlopeInterceptLine(double k, double d) {
027                this.k = k;
028                this.d = d;
029        }
030        
031        public double getK() {
032                return k;
033        }
034
035        public double getD() {
036                return d;
037        }
038        
039        public double[] getParameters() {
040                return new double[] {k, d};
041        }
042        
043        public static SlopeInterceptLine from(AlgebraicLine al) {
044                double[] p = al.getParameters();        // =(A,B,C)
045                if (Arithmetic.isZero(p[1])) {          // B == 0?
046                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert vertical line (B=0)");
047                }
048                return new SlopeInterceptLine(-p[0]/p[1], -p[2]/p[1]);  // =(-A/B, -C/B)
049        }
050        
051        @Override
052        public String toString() {
053                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <k=%.3f, d=%.3f>",
054                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), k, d);
055        }
056        
057        // --------------------------------------------------
058        
059        public static void main (String[] args) {
060                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(1, 2);
061                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(4, 3);
062                AlgebraicLine al1 = AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2);
063                System.out.println("al1 = " + al1);
064                SlopeInterceptLine sl = SlopeInterceptLine.from(al1);
065                System.out.println("sl = " + sl);
066                AlgebraicLine al2 = AlgebraicLine.from(sl);
067                System.out.println("al2 = " + al2);
068                System.out.println("al1 = al2 ? " + al1.equals(al2));
069        }
070        /*
071        al1 = AlgebraicLine <a=-0.316, b=0.949, c=-1.581>
072        sl = SlopeInterceptLine <k=0.333, d=1.667>
073        al2 = AlgebraicLine <a=0.316, b=-0.949, c=1.581>
074        al1 = al2 ? true
075        */
076}
